result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desree L Reimer

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 2:12 pm.
INCLUDES: 21CF251 21CF912 21CM423 21CM651 22CF181 22CF313. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and by Attorney Jessica Phelps. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
21CF251 
Ct.1(Possession of Methamphetamine)>>DRI.

21CF912 
Ct.3(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.
Ct.4(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.

21CM423 
Ct.1(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>>DRI.
Ct.3(Misd.BJ)>> DRI.

21CM651 
Ct.2(Intent. Fail/Provide Water for Animal[PTAC])>>DRI.
Ct.3(Intention. Imp.Animal Shelter-Sanitation[PTAC])>>DRI.

22CF181 
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>
Ct.2(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>DRI.

22CF313 
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
21CF912 
Ct.1(Arson of Building w/o Owners Consent)>>NO CONTEST.
Ct.2(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>GUILTY.

21CM651 
Ct.1(Intent. Fail/Provide Food for Animal[PTAC])>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
21CF912 --
Ct.1>>SWH for 5 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Serve 90 days MCJ, no objection to huber or EMP.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety, with the exception of medications as prescribed.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Ct.2>>SWH for 1 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS:   Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety, with the exception of medications as prescribed.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

21CM651 --
Ct.1>>SWH for 1 years probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS:   Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety, with the exception of medications as prescribed.  May not own, possess or care for any animals.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample.  Pay restitution in the amount of $420.27, along with the 10% surcharge.  

Court grants 103 days credit, not to be applied to Ct. 1 in 21CF912. 
Court grants 60 days to report to MCJ. 

Adj: 2:28 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Review hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on March 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
